channel.title: Mystery Box
channel.description: Hey guys what's up? Ok so I was hoping someone can help me out here. I am trying to figure out how players can open a Mystery Box and get a rare item, such as Korasi, Torva, D claws, party hats, or whatever. And also can someone help me out with adding dragon claws and vls to my server? SERVER INFO: Allstar Source (317) Thanks!

item.title: Mystery Box
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“Host Gushers, post:3, topic:516864”][quote author=DAn0194 link=topic=635126.msg4284928#msg4284928 date=1366220948]
I have never used an allstar but probably a code like this.

if(itemid == 6199) { // this is if they click a mystery box
deleteItem(6199, 1); //this deletes the mystery box so they can’t keep getting items
int[] rares = {}; //Just put whatever item ids you want here
addItem(rares[misc.random(rares.length)], 1); // this makes it a random of chance of what the get
}

I don’t know where you would put this code but it would most likely look something like this.
[/quote]
That looks like it is for pi?[/quote]

How does that look like its pi it can be used for everything.

Read full topic

item.title: Mystery Box
item.dc:creator: @Host_Gushers Host Gushers
item.description:
@Host_Gushers wrote:

[quote=“GodexCAB, post:11, topic:516864”][quote author=Host Gushers link=topic=635126.msg4284946#msg4284946 date=1366222010]
do u have teamviewer? pm me info, ill help you
[/quote]

I don’t have TeamViewer, I can show you my screen on Skype though. Only problem with that is my mic dont work.[/quote]
download teamviewer really quick.

Read full topic

item.title: Mystery Box
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

You should really go learn java because every day i see 3 questions+… just learn :
if
else
boolean
ints
And thats it you are ready for rsps basics, And its not really metter where you put an int, if you want the int public (for other classes)
use public int … = …; and usually you dont want to put an int inside a method (only if you want to use this int later)

I am just going to tell you where to put the code…
Search for this:
CheckForSkillUse3, under switch add your item case checking like host told you…

Read full topic

item.title: Mystery Box
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

You should really go learn java because every day i see 3 questions+… just learn :
if
else
boolean
ints
And thats it you are ready for rsps basics, And its not really metter where you put an int, if you want the int public (for other classes)
use public int … = …; and usually you dont want to put an int inside a method (only if you want to use this int later)

I am just going to tell you where to put the code…
Search for this:
CheckForSkillUse3, under switch add your item case checking like host told you…

Read full topic

item.title: Mystery Box
item.dc:creator: @Host_Gushers Host Gushers
item.description:
@Host_Gushers wrote:

ok, i think i know what to do.

Go into item.java and add this:

public static int mysteryb[] = {####, ####, ####, ####}; (Replace the #'s with id’s)

Now (still in item.java):

public static int randomMBox() { return mysteryb[(int) (Math.random() * mysteryb.length)]; }

Now add:

case 6199: c.sM("You Open A Mystery Box!"); c.deleteItem(6199, 1); c.addItem(Item.randomMBox(), 1); break;

Read full topic

Because I know I put something n client.java, then the one I was looking at said to put something else in clicking.java or clicks.java and I do not have either of those two.
